result.execSummary:
All charges against Nickolas L. Noland in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nickolas L. Noland is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolas L. Noland

1:35 PM - case called.  Defendant Nickolas L. Noland appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of the complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Defendant directed to contact the public defender office on this new matter.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
